ygData.subject: RE: Lullaby
ygData.msgSnippet: Good plan John.  I ve found Baelish from Caster s Realm is usually able to get attention on matters where no amount of screaming from others has any effect.  I
ygData.messageBody:
Good plan John. I've found Baelish from Caster's Realm is usually able to
get attention on matters where no amount of screaming from others has any
effect. I never got any reply from GZ on my earlier posts and emails that
Lullaby was not working until I elicited Baelish's assistance. The day
after Baelish responded that he would ask the question for me, GZ sent
emails to everyone who had sent him emails about lullaby problems and a
second one to me asking for more info on the data I had sent him 4+ weeks
previously.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Wednesday, February 16, 2000 11:00 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Lullaby


From: <kim@...>

On Wed, 16 Feb 2000, Perhaps a Princess... wrote:
>
> Note: Abashi is perfectly aware of the practice of bumping. He has
mentioned
> it before. He does not put more emphasis on things bumped than other
things.
> Because he knows that is artificial to get it to the top of the list,
> NOT more discussion/information.

If you read the testing and data I got, you'll see I put
enough work in it that there is no room for discussion. It is
not subjective, it is completely objective, with I'd guess
about 99.99% certainty, proof that Lullaby is indeed broken.
When I put it together, I wanted it to be irrefutable and took
steps to cover ever contingency I could think of (which is why
there's no room for discussion - I've already addresses any
issues anyone may want to discuss :). There are other posts
with fair to good statistical data, but there's lots of
discussion on them beccause the results are not as clear.
Not trying to sound egotistical, but it is the most
technically and statistically solid post I've ever seen on
that board. If Verant wants to ignore it... well, I would
interpret that as a statement from Verant that they don't care
about a bug that renders one of a class' primary abilities
(crowd control) virtually useless.

I'm waiting for the patch and until Thursday (1 business week)
for a reply. If there is none, I'll email it to the folks at
castersrealm to see if they can elicit a response.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
